moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3:
so far so good ;)
I almost always play this part with white.
moves.2... d6:
bad move of black, it blocks his bishop on the black line.
Nc6 would have been better.
moves.3. d4: I don't mind getting more control in the center, therefore I push my pawn forward to d4.
moves.3... Bg4: ow how cute he attacks my knight.
moves.4. d5: well I don't want to be forced to strike back with the g-pawn so I move my pawn to d5 to prevent it from being taken.
moves.4... Bxf3 5. Qxf3:
well I didn't expect this trade so soon, but my queen is now active and I'll leave it standing here untill I find the need to move it again.
It is in no danger of being attacked on the first 3 moves.
moves.5... Nf6 6. Nc3 Na6 7. Bb5+: hmmm his knight left the back squares leaving the field c6 undefended. I can win a pawn if black moves as I hope.
moves.7... Nd7:
he didn't play c6 as I was hoping, but at least my queen got more movement freedom.
I might save that movement for later.
moves.8. h4: planning to play Bg5, but not certain if this is such a good idea.
moves.8... Nb4: strong move. black's knight is finally becoming active.
moves.9. Ba4: I need to defend c2 but I don't want to move my queen away from the f-line.
moves.9... b5: black tries to lure me into Bxb5 after which he takes c2 with his knight and wins my rock.
moves.10. Nxb5: thankfully my knight was also protecting b5.
moves.10... Nc5: after this move black never got a chance to avoid checkmate.
moves.11. Nxd6+: check with both my knight and my bisschop so he has to move his king.
moves.11... Ke7 12. Nf5+: again check with my knight, his king is forced to move along.
moves.12... Kf6 13. Nh6+: and another check in the sequence leading to checkmate.
moves.13... Ke7: black probably thought that I would move my knight to f5 again.
moves.14. Qxf7+:
I took his pawn at f7 with check, black has only 1 move remaining: Kd6.
after which I planned to move my knight to f5 with checkmate.
